competitions.title: NeurIPS 2024 ML4CFD Competition: Harnessing Machine Learning for Computational Fluid Dynamics in Airfoil Design
competitions.description: Develop ML surrogate models for steady-state aerodynamic simulations around 2D airfoils, evaluated on predictive accuracy, physical fidelity, computational efficiency, and out-of-distribution generalization using the AirfRANS dataset.

competitions.title: The NeurIPS 2024 LLM Privacy Challenge
competitions.description: Red Team develops attacks to extract private data from LLMs, Blue Team develops defenses. Evaluated on attack success rate and defense robustness for data privacy in large language models.

competitions.title: FAIR Universe HiggsML Uncertainty Challenge
competitions.description: Measure the Higgs boson signal strength and produce credible confidence intervals from tabular particle physics data (28 features, 280M instances), accounting for systematic uncertainties in the simulator.

competitions.title: The Concordia Contest: Advancing the Cooperative Intelligence of Language Agents
competitions.description: Design a single LLM-powered agent to compete across five cooperation-eliciting scenarios (negotiation, reciprocity, reputation management, compromise, sanctioning) in text-based multi-agent environments using the Concordia framework.

competitions.title: Erasing the Invisible: A Stress-Test Challenge for Image Watermarks
competitions.description: Remove invisible watermarks from images while preserving visual quality. Black-box track (unknown watermark method) and beige-box track (known method). Evaluated on watermark removal rate and image quality metrics.

competitions.title: AI-Face: A Million-Scale Demographically Annotated AI-Generated Face Dataset and Fairness Benchmark
competitions.description: Detect AI-generated deepfake faces while ensuring fairness across demographic groups. Uses the million-scale AI-Face dataset with demographic annotations. Evaluated on detection AUC and fairness generalization metrics.

competitions.title: EEG Foundation Challenge: From Cross-Task to Cross-Subject EEG Decoding
competitions.description: Build models that zero-shot decode new tasks and new subjects from high-density EEG (128 channels, 3000+ subjects). Transfer challenge and psychopathology factor prediction from the HBN-EEG dataset.
